query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Io dico, seguitando, ch’assai prima 2 che noi fossimo al piè de l’alta torre, 3 li occhi nostri n’andar suso a la cima
4 per due fiammette che i vedemmo porre, 5 e un’altra da lungi render cenno, 6 tanto ch’a pena il potea l’occhio tòrre.
query.result:
**English:**
1 I say, continuing, that long before 2 we were at the foot of the high tower, 3 our eyes went up to the top
4 because of two flames that we saw placed there, 5 and another from afar giving a signal, 6 so that the eye could barely make it out.
**Cornish:**
1 Me a lever, ow kul, kyns o bell 2 genesen ni dheler an tŵr ughel, 3 an dhewlyn ni a wrug sevel dhe benn
4 rag dhew flamm a weles ni settya, 5 hag unn arall a bell ow ros henna, 6 kepar dell o an lagha a alla.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 E io mi volsi al mar di tutto ’l senno; 8 dissi: «Questo che dice? e che risponde 9 quell’ altro foco? e chi son quei che ’l fenno?».
query.result:
**English:**
7 And I turned to the sea of all wisdom; 8 I said: “What does this one say? and what does 9 that other fire answer? and who are those who made them?”.
**Cornish:**
7 Ha my a droes dhe’n mor a oll an fur, 8 ow leveris: “Pyth yw henna a lever? ha pyth 9 yw henna tan arall owth atteb? ha pwy yw henna a wrug?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Ed elli a me: «Su per le sucide onde 11 già scorgere puoi quello che s’aspetta, 12 se ’l fummo del pantan nol ti nasconde».
query.result:
**English:**
10 And he to me: “Up over the suicidal waves 11 you can already make out that which is awaited, 12 if the smoke of the marsh does not hide it from you”.
**Cornish:**
10 Ha henna dhymm: “Wartha dhe’n tonnow marow 11 a wra gena gweles henna a wra gorthys, 12 mar nascondi an moyth an morva dhymm dhytho”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Corda non pinse mai da sé saetta 14 che sì corresse via per l’aere snella, 15 com’ io vidi una nave piccioletta
16 venir per l’acqua verso noi in quella, 17 sotto ’l governo d’un sol galeoto, 18 che gridava: «Or se’ giunta, anima fella!».
query.result:
**English:**
13 Never did a cord think of an arrow for itself 14 that ran so swiftly through the air, 15 as I saw a tiny boat
16 coming towards us across the water, 17 under the guidance of a single boatman, 18 who shouted: “Now you have arrived, wicked soul!”.
**Cornish:**
13 Nag yth poes korden byth a wrug saeth dhodho, 14 a rennje kemmys vyth dre’n ayr, 15 dell vyth gweles kaven vyghan
16 ow tos dhe’n dowr dhe’n ni, 17 danvonn unn morvoryon, 18 ow leveris: “Wrug os hwegh, eneval ankow!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 «Flegïàs, Flegïàs, tu gridi a vòto», 20 disse lo mio segnore, «a questa volta: 21 più non ci avrai che sol passando il loto».
query.result:
**English:**
19 "Phlegyas, Phlegyas, you cry out in vain," 20 said my lord, "this time: 21 you will have no more than just passing over the marsh."
**Cornish:**
19 "Flegïàs, Flegïàs, te a wragh yn omdhre," 20 a leveris ow arluth, "an termyn ma: 21 nyns yw genes ganses tremena an loth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Qual è colui che grande inganno ascolta 23 che li sia fatto, e poi se ne rammarca, 24 fecesi Flegïàs ne l’ira accolta.
query.result:
**English:**
22 What is he who listens to great deceit, 23 that it is done to him, and then grieves for it, 24 Phlegyas made himself in the wrath he harbored.**Cornish:**
22 Pyth yw henna a glew an golan bras, 23 hag yw gwres ganso ha bos, 24 Flegïàs a wrug yn an golan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Lo duca mio discese ne la barca, 26 e poi mi fece intrare appresso lui; 27 e sol quand’ io fui dentro parve carca.
query.result:
**English:**
25 My leader descended into the boat, 26 and then he made me enter after him; 27 and only when I was inside did it seem laden.**Cornish:**
25 Y'n dyghow a dhyskynnas yn an gwari, 26 ha wosa henna ev a wrug vy omdhemedhes; 27 ha pan oen oen oen omma a-ves oen lestys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Tosto che ’l duca e io nel legno fui, 29 segando se ne va l’antica prora 30 de l’acqua più che non suol con altrui.
query.result:
**English:**
28 As soon as the leader and I were in the boat, 29 the ancient prow cuts through 30 the water more than it usually does with others.**Cornish:**
28 Kyns ages an dyghow ha my yn an lester, 29 an prora koth a-dro dheworth, 30 moy ages an dowr ages henna a wra gans dus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Mentre noi corravam la morta gora, 32 dinanzi mi si fece un pien di fango, 33 e disse: «Chi se’ tu che vieni anzi ora?».
query.result:
**English:**
31 While we were running along the dead shore, 32 in front of me appeared one covered in mud, 33 and he said: "Who are you who come before your time?".**Cornish:**
32 Pan oen ni a-redya an menydh marow, 33 diraghes vyth omma unn plen a fango, 34 ha leverel: "Pyth os ti a dheuth kyns an eur?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E io a lui: «S’i’ vegno, non rimango; 35 ma tu chi se’, che sì se’ fatto brutto?». 36 Rispuose: «Vedi che son un che piango».
query.result:
**English:**
34 And I to him: "If I come, I do not remain; 35 but who are you, who have become so ugly?". 36 He answered: "See that I am one who weeps".
**Cornish:**
34 Ha my a-dho: "Ma'th fydh, ny wra vyth; 35 mes pyw yw ty, pyth yw kemmys rudh?". 36 Ev a-leveris: "Gweles vyth owth ow kewsel".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 E io a lui: «Con piangere e con lutto, 38 spirito maladetto, ti rimani; 39 ch’i’ ti conosco, ancor sie lordo tutto».
query.result:
**English:**
37 And I to him: "With weeping and with mourning, 38 cursed spirit, may you remain; 39 for I know you, even though you are all filthy".
**Cornish:**
37 Ha my a-dho: "Gans whyla ha galar, 38 sperys drwg, ty a wra vyth; 39 rag y'th yllons, pub vyth ty a-dho".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Allor distese al legno ambo le mani; 41 per che ’l maestro accorto lo sospinse, 42 dicendo: «Via costà con li altri cani!».
query.result:
**English:**
40 Then he stretched both his hands to the wood; 41 whereupon the wise master pushed him away, 42 saying: "Away with you there with the other dogs!".
**Cornish:**
40 Pan wosa ystynna y dhewdorn dhe'y dhewlagas; 41 rag an mester sprylys a-dho gwaya, 42 ow leverel: "Kwymma gensi gans an kynnow erel!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Lo collo poi con le braccia mi cinse; 44 basciommi ’l volto e disse: «Alma sdegnosa, 45 benedetta colei che ’n te s’incinse!
46 Quei fu al mondo persona orgogliosa; 47 bontà non è che sua memoria fregi: 48 così s’è l’ombra sua qui furïosa.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Quanti si tegnon or là sù gran regi 50 che qui staranno come porci in brago, 51 di sé lasciando orribili dispregi!».
query.result:
**English:**
49 How many who now hold themselves as great kings up there 50 will wallow here like swine in the mire, 51 leaving behind them horrible contempt!
**Cornish:**
49 Pyth yw an re beu yn reow meur y’n uhella 50 a vydh yma avel hwch yn brago, 51 ow tos owth anedha anedrek orth!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 E io: «Maestro, molto sarei vago 53 di vederlo attuffare in questa broda 54 prima che noi uscissimo del lago».
query.result: **English:**52And I: "Master, I would be very keen 53to see him plunged into this broth 54before we leave the lake."**Cornish:**52Ha my: "Mestr, meur a vydh vyth 53gans ow kledha y'n an broth ma 54kyns fen ni a-dhyworth an lyn."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Ed elli a me: «Avante che la proda 56 ti si lasci veder, tu sarai sazio: 57 di tal disïo convien che tu goda».
query.result: **English:**55And he to me: "Before the bank 56lets itself be seen by you, you will be satisfied: 57you must enjoy such a desire."**Cornish:**55Ha'ytho: "Kyns an fordh a wra vethwelys, 56ty a wra soweth, ty a wra soweth: 57a wra tus ow keswlabrys an dysyr ma."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Dopo ciò poco vid’ io quello strazio 59 far di costui a le fangose genti, 60 che Dio ancor ne lodo e ne ringrazio.
query.result: **English:**58After that, I soon saw that wretch 59wreak havoc on the muddy people, 60for which God still praises and thanks me.**Cornish:**58Wosa henna, a welas vy an straz ma 59ow kul an tus ma dhe'n bobel fangek, 60hag a wra Dew byth ow toleri ha gras vy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Tutti gridavano: «A Filippo Argenti!»; 62 e ’l fiorentino spirito bizzarro 63 in sé medesmo si volvea co’ denti.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Everyone shouted: "At Filippo Argenti!"; 62 and the bizarre Florentine spirit 63 turned on himself with his teeth.
**Cornish:**
61 Pub ool o grys: "A'gas Filippo Argenti!"; 62 ha'gas spyrys florentinek bizar 63 yn y honan eth omdrehevas gans y dhens.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Quivi il lasciammo, che più non ne narro; 65 ma ne l’orecchie mi percosse un duolo, 66 per ch’io avante l’occhio intento sbarro.
query.result:
**English:**
64 There we left him, and I will say no more about him; 65 but a sound of grief struck my ears, 66 so that I opened my eyes wide in front of me.
**Cornish:**
64 Gen hwethas ev, na'gas moy nebes ankow; 65 mes yn aga klevow eth omdhrehevas dolur, 66 rag wovyn aga lagha ow skeus dheharow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Lo buon maestro disse: «Omai, figliuolo, 68 s’appressa la città c’ha nome Dite, 69 coi gravi cittadin, col grande stuolo».
query.result:
**English:**
67 The good master said: "Now, my son, 68 the city draws near that is called Dite, 69 with its grievous citizens, with its great throng."
**Cornish:**
67 An mester da a leveris: "Wella, fy mab, 68 yma yw an cita a henwir Dite, 69 gans y chyfasedh trues, gans an golon bras."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 E io: «Maestro, già le sue meschite 71 là entro certe ne la valle cerno, 72 vermiglie come se di foco uscite
73 fossero». Ed ei mi disse: «Il foco etterno 74 ch’entro l’affoca le dimostra rosse, 75 come tu vedi in questo basso inferno».
query.result:
**English:**
70 And I: "Master, already its mosques 71 down there in the valley I discern, 72 crimson as if they had come out of fire.
73" And he said to me: "The eternal fire 74 that burns within shows them red, 75 as you see in this lowest hell."
**Cornish:**
70 Ha my: "Mester, wosa y voskweyth 71 allá ena'n glyn a welaf, 72 rudhvel avel orth yns tan tan.
73" Ha ev a leveris: "An tan byth 74 a'n losk a-ji dhemonstri rudh, 75 kepar ha gweles yn an ifern isella."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Noi pur giugnemmo dentro a l’alte fosse 77 che vallan quella terra sconsolata: 78 le mura mi parean che ferro fosse.
query.result:
**English:**
76 We soon arrived within the deep ditches 77 that surround that desolate land: 78 the walls seemed to me to be made of iron.
**Cornish:**
76 Ni a dheuth yn skon dhe'n fosow ughel 77 a vall an tir dibrisys: 78 an mogerow a weles ow tosow hern.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Non sanza prima far grande aggirata, 80 venimmo in parte dove il nocchier forte 81 «Usciteci», gridò: «qui è l’intrata».
query.result:
**English:**
79 Not without first making a wide circuit, 80 we came to a place where the strong ferryman 81 shouted: "Get out here": this is the entrance."
**Cornish:**
79 Heb marnas kyns gwruthylla meur, 80 ni a dheuth dhe le unn le may an nochyer kryf 81 "A-ves", a leveris: "Heman yw an entre."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Io vidi più di mille in su le porte 83 da ciel piovuti, che stizzosamente 84 dicean: «Chi è costui che sanza morte
85 va per lo regno de la morta gente?».
query.result:
**English:**
82 I saw more than a thousand at the gates 83 raining down from heaven, who angrily 84 said: "Who is this who without death
85 goes through the kingdom of the dead people?"
**Cornish:**
82 Me a welas moy es mil war an fordhow 83 ow tispledh a'n nef, ow leverel yn kren, 84 "Piv yw hemma a-ves heb marow
85 ow mos drehedhes an wlas a'n werin marow?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
86 E ’l savio mio maestro fece segno 87 di voler lor parlar segretamente.
88 Allor chiusero un poco il gran disdegno 89 e disser: «Vien tu solo, e quei sen vada 90 che sì ardito intrò per questo regno.
query.result:
**English:**
86 And my wise master made a sign 87 of wanting to speak to them secretly.
88 Then they restrained their great disdain a little 89 and said: "Come you alone, and let him go away 90 who entered this realm so boldly."
**Cornish:**
86 Ha'gasavydhfurfagrethmerth 87 avelhembosparladhansoweth.
88 Anwedhenklynsonsymperthynfoweth 89 ha leverel: "Ty a wra vyth onan, ha gans dhavos 90 a dheuth yn fetha dhe'n rannma."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Sol si ritorni per la folle strada: 92 pruovi, se sa; ché tu qui rimarrai, 93 che li ha’ iscorta sì buia contrada».
query.result:
**English:**
91 Only return by the mad road: 92 try, if you know how; for here you will remain, 93 for you have escorted them along such a dark path."
**Cornish:**
91 An gwiskas orth an fordh fol: 92 prof, mar tos; ragma an-ma ty a wra, 93 ragtha'th eskorrys orth fordh kyns tywyll."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Pensa, lettor, se io mi sconfortai 95 nel suon de le parole maladette, 96 ché non credetti ritornarci mai.
query.result:
**English:**
94 Think, reader, if I was discouraged 95 at the sound of the cursed words, 96 for I did not believe I would ever return.
**Cornish:**
94 Meur, lenner, ha'm sconfortyas 95 yn son an gerow malethys, 96 rag na grysys bythyn dyworthsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 «O caro duca mio, che più di sette 98 volte m’hai sicurtà renduta e tratto 99 d’alto periglio che ’ncontra mi stette,
100 non mi lasciar», diss’ io, «così disfatto; 101 e se ’l passar più oltre ci è negato, 102 ritroviam l’orme nostre insieme ratto».
query.result:
**English:**
97 "O my dear leader, who more than seven 98 times have given me safety and rescued 99 me from great peril that stood against me,
100 do not leave me," I said, "so undone; 101 and if passing further is denied to us, 102 let us quickly retrace our steps together."
**Cornish:**
97 "O ker an dukkem, moy es seyth 98 gweyth m'eus seyrheth seyrtheth ha treylyth 99 a-ugh peryll meur a-ugh a-ugh yn agasow,
100 na'm gorra," me a leveris, "vel dhiskarrys; 101 ha'gasow tremena pella yw gwrys dhyn, 102 gwra dyllo dhyn gans agan gressow bys vyth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 E quel segnor che lì m’avea menato, 104 mi disse: «Non temer; ché ’l nostro passo 105 non ci può tòrre alcun: da tal n’è dato.
query.result:
**English:**
103 And that lord who had led me there, 104 said to me: "Do not fear; for our passage 105 cannot be taken from us by anyone: it is granted by such a one."
**Cornish:**
103 Ha'gan argluydh a'm gorra hwathsa, 104 a leveris dhym: "Na vynnaf; rag an fordh 105 nyns yw possybyl dhe'n kemer gans neb: rag y feu res dhe'n keth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Ma qui m’attendi, e lo spirito lasso 107 conforta e ciba di speranza buona, 108 ch’i’ non ti lascerò nel mondo basso».
query.result:
**English:**
106 But here wait for me, and comfort and nourish 107 my weary spirit with good hope, 108 for I will not leave you in the world below."
**Cornish:**
106 Mes yma kavoel, ha'gas an spyrys dalleth 107 kusul ha boos ha'gas goon spyrans, 108 rag nyns gwell vy yn bys isel."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Così sen va, e quivi m’abbandona 110 lo dolce padre, e io rimagno in forse, 111 che sì e no nel capo mi tenciona.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Thus he departs, and here he leaves me, 110 my sweet father, and I remain in doubt, 111 for yes and no contend in my head.
**Cornish:**
109 Vel dh'ytholl, ha'gas yma'm gwell yn unnik, 110 an tas dhe, ha my a wra yn ansoedh, 111 rag ie ha nag a wra yn stryf yn'n ben.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Udir non potti quello ch’a lor porse; 113 ma ei non stette là con essi guari, 114 che ciascun dentro a pruova si ricorse.
query.result:
**English:**
112 I could not hear what he said to them; 113 but I did not stay there with them long, 114 for each of them ran back inside, vying with the others.
**Cornish:**
112 Nyns gallosem klevas an peth a leveris dhedha; 113 mes nyns ollowis eno gans anedha hir, 114 rag pub onan a redya yn-mes a-berth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Chiuser le porte que’ nostri avversari 116 nel petto al mio segnor, che fuor rimase 117 e rivolsesi a me con passi rari.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Our adversaries shut the gates 116 in my lord's chest, so that he remained outside, 117 and he turned to me with slow steps.
**Cornish:**
115 Anedha a dhegys an fordhow nyns gwithyas 116 yn krev an arluydh vy, a veu dheworto, 117 ha'gas a droos dhymm orth vy gans passys araf.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Li occhi a la terra e le ciglia avea rase 119 d’ogne baldanza, e dicea ne’ sospiri: 120 «Chi m’ha negate le dolenti case!».
query.result:
**English:**
118 His eyes were fixed on the ground and his eyelashes were shorn 119 of all boldness, and he said with sighs: 120 “Who has denied me the sorrowful houses!”.
**Cornish:**
118 An lagha dhe'n dor ha'n kegil o veu rase 119 d’ogne baldanza, ha dyw ne'n sospiri: 120 “Piw m’ha negate an dolenti case!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 E a me disse: «Tu, perch’ io m’adiri, 122 non sbigottir, ch’io vincerò la prova, 123 qual ch’a la difension dentro s’aggiri.
query.result:
**English:**
121 And to me he said: "You, why are you afraid, 122 do not be dismayed, for I will conquer the trial, 123 whoever goes about inside for the defense.
**Cornish:**
121 Ha dhomm: "Ty, perag om m'edhiri, 122 na wra vydh, rag y'm gwynnons an preuf, 123 pywhag a wra a-dro dhe'n difens."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Questa lor tracotanza non è nova; 125 ché già l’usaro a men segreta porta, 126 la qual sanza serrame ancor si trova.
query.result:
**English:**
124 This arrogance of theirs is not new; 125 for they already used it to lead me secretly, 126 through a door that is still open without a lock.**Cornish:**
124 An tryghowna-ma na wra nowydh; 125 rag es ens ow tisqueth dhe'm dhewedh kudyn, 126 an dhor na wra serrame bythkweth ow kavos.**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Sovr’ essa vedestù la scritta morta: 128 e già di qua da lei discende l’erta, 129 passando per li cerchi sanza scorta,
130 tal che per lui ne fia la terra aperta».
query.result:
**English:**
127 Above it you see the dead inscription: 128 and already from this side of it the steep path descends, 129 passing through the circles without a guide,
130 so that through it the earth will be opened for him.**Cornish:**
127 Uwch henna yth gweles an skrif marow: 128 ha warbarth henna yth kodha an fordh, 129 ow tremen dre'n kelgh heb kenner,
130 marow henna y feu an nor dhegorrys.**
